title: Instrumentation Engineering PYQ (IN)
description: Comprehensive GATE Instrumentation Engineering assessment covering General Aptitude and Core Instrumentation Engineering subjects. This assessment includes 10 aptitude questions (15% weight) and 55 core instrumentation engineering questions (85% weight) following the official GATE pattern.
whatIsDescription: GATE (Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering) Instrumentation Engineering is a national-level examination that primarily tests the comprehensive understanding of various undergraduate subjects in instrumentation engineering including Electrical and Electronic Measurements, Signals and Systems, Control Systems, Analog and Digital Electronics, Transducers, and Industrial Instrumentation. This assessment follows the official GATE pattern with General Aptitude and Core Instrumentation Engineering questions.

typicalCareers.title: Instrumentation Engineer
typicalCareers.description: Design and maintain measurement and control systems for industrial processes

modules: Core Instrumentation Engineering Assessment (55 questions, 85 marks)

aptitude.title: General Aptitude Assessment
aptitude.description: Test your general aptitude including verbal ability, quantitative aptitude, and analytical reasoning skills. This section carries 15% weight in the total assessment.

questions.text: The price of an item is increased by 10% and then decreased by 10%. The net change in price is:
questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude - Percentage
questions.explanation: Let the original price be P. Increase by 10%: P(1.1). Decrease by 10%: P(1.1)(0.9) = P(0.99). The net change is a 100-99=1% decrease.

questions.text: The ratio of the speed of a boat in still water to the speed of the current is 5:1. If the boat travels a certain distance downstream in 3 hours, what is the time taken to travel the same distance upstream?
questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude - Time & Distance
questions.explanation: Let speed of boat be 5x and current be x. Downstream speed = 6x. Upstream speed = 4x. Distance D = 6x × 3 = 18x. Upstream time T = D / 4x = 18x / 4x = 4.5 hours.

questions.text: Choose the most appropriate word from the options given below to complete the following sentence: The candidate's statement was a ___ of truth.
questions.subject: Verbal Ability - Vocabulary
questions.explanation: A 'travesty of truth' means a grotesque misrepresentation or distortion of the truth. 'Dearth' means scarcity, which does not fit the context.

questions.text: Find the next term in the series: 3, 7, 13, 21, 31, ...
questions.subject: Analytical Reasoning - Number Series
questions.explanation: The differences between consecutive terms are 4, 6, 8, 10. The next difference should be 12. Thus, 31 + 12 = 43.

questions.text: If f(x) = |x-2| + |x-5|, the minimum value of f(x) is:
questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude - Calculus/Functions
questions.explanation: The function f(x) represents the sum of distances from x to 2 and x to 5. The minimum value occurs for x between 2 and 5, where f(x) = (x-2) + (5-x) = 3.

questions.text: A clock shows 4:30. What is the angle between the hour and minute hands?
questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude - Clocks/Geometry

questions.text: The synonym for 'Mellifluous' is:
questions.subject: Verbal Ability - Vocabulary (Synonyms)
questions.explanation: 'Mellifluous' means a sound that is sweet and musical; pleasant to hear. 'Harmonious' is the closest synonym.

questions.text: In a group, 70% of the students speak English and 50% speak Hindi. If 40 students speak both, what is the total number of students in the group?
questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude - Set Theory
questions.explanation: Percentage speaking both = (70% + 50%) - 100% = 20%. If 20% of total X is 40, then 0.20 × X = 40, so X = 200.

questions.text: The pair of words that best expresses a similar relationship as 'Surgeon : Scalpel' is:
questions.subject: Verbal Ability - Analogy
questions.explanation: The relationship is 'Person : Primary Tool'. A Surgeon uses a Scalpel; a Sculptor uses a Chisel.

questions.text: A sum of money doubles in 5 years at simple interest. In how many years will it become four times?
questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude - Simple Interest
questions.explanation: To double, Interest (I) must be 1P, taking 5 years. To become four times, I must be 3P. Since simple interest is linear, it takes 3 × 5 = 15 years.

core.title: Core Instrumentation Engineering Assessment
core.description: Comprehensive assessment covering Engineering Mathematics, Electrical and Electronic Measurements, Signals and Systems, Control Systems, Analog and Digital Electronics, Transducers, and Industrial Instrumentation. This section carries 85% weight in the total assessment.

questions.text: The primary cause of creeping error in an induction type energy meter is:
questions.subject: Measurements
questions.explanation: Creeping is the slow, continuous rotation of the meter disc when only the voltage coil is energized (no load current). It is caused by over-compensation for friction or excessive vibration, making the voltage coil torque too high.

questions.text: A Thermistor is generally used as a temperature sensor because it has:
questions.subject: Transducers
questions.explanation: Thermistors (specifically NTC type) are semiconductor-based. Their resistance drops rapidly and non-linearly with increasing temperature, providing high sensitivity.

questions.text: The Routh array shows a row of zeros. This indicates the presence of:

options.text: No poles in the right half s-plane.
A pair of roots that are symmetric about the origin.
At least one pole at the origin.

questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: A row of zeros in the Routh array indicates that the characteristic equation has roots that are symmetrically located with respect to the origin (e.g., complex conjugate pair on the jω axis, or a pair of real roots ±σ). These are roots of the auxiliary equation.

questions.text: If f(t) = e^(-at) u(t), its Laplace Transform F(s) is:
questions.subject: Engineering Mathematics/Signals and Systems
questions.explanation: This is the standard Laplace Transform pair for the exponentially decaying function: L{e^(-at) u(t)} = 1/(s+a), with ROC Re(s) > -a.

questions.text: The sensitivity of a measurement system is defined as the ratio of:
questions.subject: Measurements
questions.explanation: Sensitivity is the measure of the change in the output signal per unit change in the measured input quantity: Sensitivity = ΔOutput/ΔInput.

questions.text: A Piezoresistive Strain Gauge measures strain by detecting changes in:
questions.subject: Transducers
questions.explanation: Piezoresistive means 'pressure-sensitive resistance'. These strain gauges (typically semiconductors) utilize the change in electrical resistance when a mechanical strain (stress) is applied.

questions.text: For a unity feedback control system with open loop transfer function G(s) = 10/(s(s+1)), the steady-state error for a unit ramp input is:
questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: The system is Type 1. The static acceleration error constant is Kv = lim(s→0) s G(s) = lim(s→0) s × 10/(s(s+1)) = 10. The steady-state error for a unit ramp input is ess = 1/Kv = 1/10 = 0.1.

questions.text: A 4½-digit Digital Voltmeter (DVM) has a maximum reading of:
questions.subject: Measurements
questions.explanation: A 4½-digit meter has four full digits (0 to 9) and one half-digit (0 or 1). The maximum count is 19999 (e.g., 1.9999 on the 2V range).

questions.text: The condition for a system to be Linear is that it must satisfy the principles of:
questions.subject: Signals and Systems
questions.explanation: Linearity requires the satisfaction of both the homogeneity (scaling: c·x(t) → c·y(t)) and additivity (superposition: x1(t) + x2(t) → y1(t) + y2(t)) properties.

questions.text: The output of an operational amplifier in a non-inverting configuration is:

options.text: 180° out of phase with the input.

questions.subject: Analog Electronics
questions.explanation: The non-inverting amplifier configuration applies the input to the non-inverting terminal. The output voltage is amplified and has the same phase as the input voltage.

questions.text: The strain gauge factor (Gf) is defined as:
questions.subject: Transducers
questions.explanation: The gauge factor is the ratio of the fractional change in resistance (ΔR/R) to the fractional change in length (strain, ε = ΔL/L): Gf = (ΔR/R)/ε.

questions.text: The maximum number of poles a stable unity feedback system can have on the jω-axis is:
questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: For a system to be strictly stable (as implied by 'stable' in most contexts), it cannot have any poles on the jω-axis. Poles on the jω-axis only lead to marginal stability (undamped oscillations).

questions.text: The Wheatstone Bridge is mainly used for the precision measurement of:
questions.subject: Measurements
questions.explanation: The Wheatstone bridge is the fundamental circuit for accurately determining an unknown electrical resistance by balancing two legs of a bridge circuit.

questions.text: The transfer function of a system with impulse response h(t) is given by the:

options.text: Convolution of h(t) with the input.

questions.subject: Signals and Systems/Control Systems
questions.explanation: The transfer function G(s) is the Laplace Transform of the impulse response h(t), assuming zero initial conditions: G(s) = L{h(t)}.

questions.text: The major reason for preferring digital signal processing over analog signal processing is:
questions.subject: Signals and Systems
questions.explanation: Once a signal is digitized, it can be processed without introducing additional noise or being susceptible to parameter drift (ageing) of components, unlike analog circuits.

questions.text: The sensitivity of a control system to variations in the forward path gain is reduced by:
questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: Negative feedback is universally used to make the closed-loop gain much less sensitive to variations in the system components and external disturbances.

questions.text: A linear variable differential transformer (LVDT) is an inductive transducer used to measure:
questions.subject: Transducers
questions.explanation: The name itself specifies its function: Linear Variable Differential Transformer is an electromagnetic device that converts linear motion (displacement) into an electrical signal.

questions.text: The internal resistance of an ideal voltmeter is:
questions.subject: Measurements
questions.explanation: An ideal voltmeter should draw zero current from the circuit it measures, ensuring it doesn't disturb the measurement. This is achieved with infinite internal resistance.

questions.text: The J-K flip-flop operates in the toggle mode when the inputs J and K are:
questions.subject: Digital Electronics
questions.explanation: When both J and K inputs are high (J=1, K=1), the output of the flip-flop complements its previous state on every clock pulse (Qn+1 = Q̄n).

questions.text: The Final Value Theorem is applicable only if the function F(s) has poles:

options.text: Only in the left half s-plane.
In the left half s-plane or a simple pole at the origin.

questions.subject: Engineering Mathematics/Signals and Systems
questions.explanation: The Final Value Theorem is valid only if lim(t→∞) f(t) exists, which requires that sF(s) has all its poles in the left-half s-plane, or at most a single, simple pole at the origin.

questions.text: The piezoelectric effect is the interconversion between:
questions.subject: Transducers
questions.explanation: The piezoelectric effect describes the ability of certain materials (like quartz) to generate an electric charge in response to applied mechanical stress (direct effect), or change shape in response to an applied voltage (converse effect).

questions.text: The damping torque in most indicating instruments is produced by:
questions.subject: Measurements
questions.explanation: Damping torque is essential to bring the pointer to rest quickly without oscillation. This is typically achieved using air friction (pneumatic damping) or eddy currents (electromagnetic damping).

questions.text: A PID controller is applied to a system. The effect of increasing the derivative action is to:
questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: Derivative control provides anticipation based on the rate of error change. This damping effect reduces overshoot and allows higher gain for faster response, thus decreasing the rise time.

questions.text: The Laplace Transform of t·u(t) is:
questions.subject: Engineering Mathematics/Signals and Systems
questions.explanation: Using the differentiation in s-domain property on L{u(t)} = 1/s, we get L{t·u(t)} = -d/ds (1/s) = -(-1/s²) = 1/s².

questions.text: The operational amplifier circuit that can perform addition and scaling of multiple input signals is the:
questions.subject: Analog Electronics
questions.explanation: The summing amplifier (or adder) circuit uses an inverting configuration with multiple input resistors to produce an output voltage that is the weighted sum of the input voltages.

questions.text: The maximum number of distinct values that can be represented by a 10-bit digital signal is:
questions.subject: Digital Electronics
questions.explanation: The number of distinct values (or levels) that can be represented by N bits is 2^N. For N=10, this is 2^10 = 1024.

questions.text: The Lissajous pattern on a CRO for signals x(t) = A sin(ωt) and y(t) = B cos(ωt) will be a:
questions.subject: Measurements
questions.explanation: The signals have the same frequency (ω) and a phase difference of 90° (cos(ωt) = sin(ωt + 90°)). This condition results in a circle (if A=B) or an ellipse (if A ≠ B).

questions.text: Which type of control system uses a relay to switch the final control element?
questions.subject: Industrial Instrumentation
questions.explanation: A two-position (ON/OFF) controller drives the output to its maximum or minimum limit based on the error sign. This switching action is typically implemented using an electrical or pneumatic relay.

questions.text: The gauge pressure measurement is relative to:
questions.subject: Industrial Instrumentation
questions.explanation: Gauge pressure is the pressure measured relative to the local atmospheric pressure. Absolute pressure is measured relative to a perfect vacuum (zero pressure).

questions.text: Which transducer is an active transducer?
questions.subject: Transducers
questions.explanation: An active transducer (self-generating) produces an electrical signal directly from the measured quantity (e.g., a Thermocouple generates voltage from temperature). Passive transducers (e.g., LVDT, Strain Gauge) require external power.

questions.text: The transfer function of a phase lag compensator contributes a phase shift that is:
questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: A phase lag compensator is designed to introduce a negative phase shift (lag) into the system over the relevant frequency range, primarily to improve the steady-state error.

questions.text: The total current entering a node in an electric circuit must equal the total current leaving the node. This is a statement of:
questions.subject: Electric Circuits
questions.explanation: Kirchhoff's Current Law (KCL) is based on the conservation of charge and states that the algebraic sum of currents entering and leaving a node (junction) is zero.

questions.text: The error function (erf(x)) is primarily related to which probability distribution?
questions.subject: Engineering Mathematics - Probability
questions.explanation: The error function erf(x) is a special function of the sigmoid shape that is closely related to the cumulative distribution function (CDF) of the Normal (Gaussian) distribution.

questions.text: The maximum output voltage from an ideal differentiator circuit for a step input voltage is theoretically:
questions.subject: Analog Electronics
questions.explanation: An ideal differentiator's output is proportional to the derivative of the input. The derivative of a step function u(t) is the Dirac impulse δ(t), which has a theoretical peak amplitude of infinite at t=0.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT an advantage of digital instruments over analog instruments?
questions.subject: Measurements
questions.explanation: Digital instruments generally have a higher cost and complexity than their basic analog counterparts, which is a disadvantage, not an advantage.

questions.text: A capacitive transducer (capacitance C) is used to measure displacement d. The relationship is:
questions.subject: Transducers
questions.explanation: The capacitance of a parallel plate capacitor is C = εA/d. If A is constant, capacitance is inversely proportional to the distance (d) between the plates.

questions.text: The steady-state error of a Type 1 unity feedback system for a parabolic input is:
questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: For a system of Type N, the steady-state error is zero for inputs of order up to N-1, finite for order N, and infinite for inputs of order greater than N. Parabolic input is order 2. Since Type 1 (N=1), the error is infinite.

questions.text: The eigenvalues of a skew-symmetric matrix are always:
questions.subject: Engineering Mathematics - Linear Algebra
questions.explanation: A key property of skew-symmetric matrices (A^T = -A) is that all of their eigenvalues are purely imaginary or zero.

questions.text: The quantization process in Analog-to-Digital Conversion (ADC) is inherently:
questions.subject: Digital Electronics
questions.explanation: Quantization maps a continuous range of values to a finite set of discrete values (steps). This step-wise relationship is inherently non-linear and irreversible (lossy).

questions.text: The piezoelectric transducer is a self-generating device, making it suitable for measuring:
questions.subject: Transducers
questions.explanation: Piezoelectric materials generate charge only when strain is changing, making them suitable for measuring dynamic phenomena like acceleration, vibration, and pressure transients.

questions.text: A standard integrator circuit using an op-amp has:

options.text: A resistor in the feedback path.
A capacitor in the feedback path.
An inductor in the feedback path.
Only a wire in the feedback path.

questions.subject: Analog Electronics
questions.explanation: The op-amp integrator has a capacitor in the negative feedback path and a resistor at the inverting input terminal.

questions.text: The primary objective of adding a reset windup protection circuit to a PID controller is to prevent:

options.text: Noise amplification by the derivative term.
The integral term from accumulating large errors when the control element is saturated.
Overshoot caused by the proportional term.

questions.subject: Industrial Instrumentation
questions.explanation: Reset windup occurs when the integral term builds up excessively while the actuator is already saturated. Anti-windup techniques limit the integral term's accumulation to avoid large overshoot when the error eventually changes sign.

questions.text: The unit of gauge factor is:
questions.subject: Transducers
questions.explanation: The gauge factor (Gf) is the ratio of two dimensionless quantities (ΔR/R and ΔL/L), making the gauge factor itself dimensionless.

questions.text: The open-loop poles and zeros of a system are defined as the roots of the:

options.text: Numerator and denominator of the closed-loop transfer function, respectively.
Numerator and denominator of the open-loop transfer function, respectively.

questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: The open-loop zeros are the roots of the numerator and the open-loop poles are the roots of the denominator of the open-loop transfer function G(s)H(s).

questions.text: The resolution of an N-bit Digital-to-Analog Converter (DAC) is:
questions.subject: Digital Electronics
questions.explanation: Resolution is the smallest analog step size that can be produced. It is V_FS/(2^N - 1), which is proportional to 1/(2^N - 1).

questions.text: The Dirac Delta function δ(t) is the derivative of the:
questions.subject: Signals and Systems
questions.explanation: The unit step function u(t) has a sudden jump at t=0. The derivative of this jump is the unit impulse function δ(t).

questions.text: If A is a square matrix, the maximum number of linearly independent eigenvectors is equal to:
questions.subject: Engineering Mathematics - Linear Algebra
questions.explanation: An N × N matrix can have at most N linearly independent eigenvectors. If the matrix is diagonalizable, it has exactly N linearly independent eigenvectors.

questions.text: The pressure transducer used to measure high pressures (up to 10,000 bar) is the:
questions.subject: Industrial Instrumentation
questions.explanation: The piezoelectric transducer is robust and has a very high natural frequency, making it suitable for measuring dynamic and extremely high pressures (shock/blast waves).

questions.text: The unity gain bandwidth (GBW) of an op-amp is the frequency at which the open-loop gain is:
questions.subject: Analog Electronics
questions.explanation: The Gain-Bandwidth Product (GBW) is defined as the frequency at which the open-loop voltage gain of an op-amp drops to unity (or 0 dB).

questions.text: For a second-order system with damping ratio ζ=0, the system response is:
questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: When ζ = 0, the system has poles on the jω-axis. The response exhibits sustained, non-decaying oscillations (undamped).

questions.text: The Fourier Series of an odd function contains only:
questions.subject: Engineering Mathematics/Signals and Systems
questions.explanation: For an odd periodic function, the a₀ (DC) and aₙ (cosine) coefficients are zero. The series contains only the bₙ (sine terms).

questions.text: The resistance of a Pt-100 RTD (Resistance Temperature Detector) at 0°C is:
questions.subject: Transducers
questions.explanation: The '100' in Pt-100 specifically denotes that the resistance of the sensor is 100 Ω at 0°C.

questions.text: Which ADC technique is known for its high speed, but low resolution for a given power consumption?
questions.subject: Digital Electronics
questions.explanation: A Flash ADC uses 2^N - 1 comparators for an N-bit output, making it extremely fast (single clock cycle) but very large, complex, and power-hungry, limiting it primarily to low-resolution, high-speed applications.

questions.text: The Bode magnitude plot slope for a simple pole at the origin (1/s) is:
questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: The gain magnitude for G(s) = 1/s is |G(jω)| = 1/ω. In dB, 20 log₁₀(1/ω) = -20 log₁₀(ω). The slope is -20 dB/decade.

questions.text: Which type of flow meter has no moving parts and relies on the Faraday's law of electromagnetic induction?
questions.subject: Industrial Instrumentation
questions.explanation: The Electromagnetic Flow Meter induces a voltage across a conductive fluid moving through a magnetic field, where the voltage is proportional to the fluid velocity (flow rate), based on the principle of electromagnetic induction.
